Calculate PFDI Scores from Minimal Dataset

Source: R/score_pfdi.R
calculate_pfdi_scores.Rd

Calculates Pelvic Floor Distress Inventory (PFDI-20) total score and subscale scores (POPDI-6, CRADI-8, and UDI-6) from raw questionnaire data.

Usage

calculate_pfdi_scores(
  input_data = NULL,
  id_column = "Record_ID",
  missing_threshold = 0.5,
  verbose = FALSE,
  output_file = NULL,
  scale_factor = 25,
  patient_data = NULL
)

Arguments

input_data

A data frame containing PFDI questionnaire responses.

id_column

Character string specifying the column name containing patient identifiers. Default is "Record_ID".

missing_threshold

Numeric value between 0 and 1 specifying the maximum proportion of missing values allowed per subscale. Default is 0.5 (50%).

verbose

Logical indicating whether to print detailed logging messages. Default is FALSE.

output_file

Character string specifying the path to save the results. If NULL (default), results are not saved to a file.

scale_factor

Numeric. The scaling factor to apply to the scores. Default is 25.

patient_data

Deprecated. Use input_data instead. A data frame containing PFDI questionnaire responses.

Value

A tibble containing patient IDs and calculated scores for PFDI-20 total and the three subscales (POPDI-6, CRADI-8, and UDI-6).

Details

The PFDI-20 consists of three subscales: POPDI-6 (questions 1-6), CRADI-8 (questions 7-14), and UDI-6 (questions 15-20). Each question uses a 0-4 scale. The function calculates the mean score for each subscale, multiplies by the scale factor (default: 25) to get a 0-100 scale, and sums the three subscale scores to get the PFDI-20 total (0-300 scale).

The function supports multiple column naming conventions including standard format (popdi_q*, cradi_q*, udi_q*), numeric format (PFDI-1 through PFDI-20), subscale-specific format (PFDI-POPDI-*, etc.), and dot notation (PFDI.1, etc.).

Examples

# Example 1: Basic usage with standard column names
patient_data <- data.frame(
  Record_ID = 1,
  popdi_q1 = 2, popdi_q2 = 1, popdi_q3 = 0,
  cradi_q1 = 1, cradi_q2 = 0, cradi_q3 = 2,
  udi_q1 = 3, udi_q2 = 1, udi_q3 = 0
)
pfdi_scores <- calculate_pfdi_scores(
  input_data = patient_data,
  scale_factor = 25,
  verbose = TRUE
)
#> INFO [2025-03-29 03:51:44] Starting PFDI score calculation
#> DEBUG [2025-03-29 03:51:44] Input parameters: id_column = Record_ID, missing_threshold = 0.5, scale_factor = 25
#> DEBUG [2025-03-29 03:51:44] Input data dimensions: 1 rows, 10 columns
#> DEBUG [2025-03-29 03:51:44] Input data column names: Record_ID, popdi_q1, popdi_q2, popdi_q3, cradi_q1, cradi_q2, cradi_q3, udi_q1, udi_q2, udi_q3
#> DEBUG [2025-03-29 03:51:44] Identifying PFDI question columns
#> DEBUG [2025-03-29 03:51:44] Found 3 standard POPDI questions
#> DEBUG [2025-03-29 03:51:44] Found 3 standard CRADI questions
#> DEBUG [2025-03-29 03:51:44] Found 3 standard UDI questions
#> DEBUG [2025-03-29 03:51:44] Total PFDI columns identified: 9
#> DEBUG [2025-03-29 03:51:44] Calculating subscale scores
#> DEBUG [2025-03-29 03:51:44] Calculating POPDI_6 score from 3 questions
#> DEBUG [2025-03-29 03:51:44] Minimum required responses: 2 out of 3 questions
#> DEBUG [2025-03-29 03:51:44] Calculated scores for 1 rows with sufficient data
#> DEBUG [2025-03-29 03:51:44] POPDI_6 score calculation complete
#> DEBUG [2025-03-29 03:51:44] Calculating CRADI_8 score from 3 questions
#> DEBUG [2025-03-29 03:51:44] Minimum required responses: 2 out of 3 questions
#> DEBUG [2025-03-29 03:51:44] Calculated scores for 1 rows with sufficient data
#> DEBUG [2025-03-29 03:51:44] CRADI_8 score calculation complete
#> DEBUG [2025-03-29 03:51:44] Calculating UDI_6 score from 3 questions
#> DEBUG [2025-03-29 03:51:44] Minimum required responses: 2 out of 3 questions
#> DEBUG [2025-03-29 03:51:44] Calculated scores for 1 rows with sufficient data
#> DEBUG [2025-03-29 03:51:44] UDI_6 score calculation complete
#> DEBUG [2025-03-29 03:51:44] Calculating total PFDI score
#> DEBUG [2025-03-29 03:51:44] Calculated total PFDI score for 1 rows
#> INFO [2025-03-29 03:51:44] PFDI score calculation completed successfully
#> DEBUG [2025-03-29 03:51:44] Output data dimensions: 1 rows, 5 columns

# Example 2: With alternative column names
alt_data <- data.frame(
  Patient_ID = "PT001",
  "PFDI-1" = 2, "PFDI-2" = 1, "PFDI-3" = 0,
  "PFDI-7" = 1, "PFDI-8" = 0, "PFDI-9" = 2,
  "PFDI-15" = 3, "PFDI-16" = 1, "PFDI-17" = 0
)
pfdi_scores <- calculate_pfdi_scores(
  input_data = alt_data,
  id_column = "Patient_ID",
  missing_threshold = 0.5
)

# Example 3: With output file
temp_file <- tempfile(fileext = ".csv")
pfdi_scores <- calculate_pfdi_scores(
  input_data = patient_data,
  output_file = temp_file
)
